page.title: 16PRESTON MILL, EAST LOTHIAN
page.content: Preston Mill, on the River Tyne, dates from the 16th century, although there may have been a mill on the site in earlier times. This water-driven mill was first used to grind oats, and later wheat, which were grown locally. The mill seems to have been built under a Dutch influence. After the Second World War the mill buildings began to deteriorate, mainly through lack of use. However Preston Mill has since been restored to working order, and is visited annually by many people who much admire the huge wheel, the red pantiled roof and the unique coned kiln.
